headline: Wonderful culture and many opportunities
author_position: Group Content and Internal Communications Manager
pros: Being a large corporate with a footprint across many regions and requiring many skills to operate, it is possible to be employed doing anything from interior design to sound engineering for town hall and webinar sessions. The company is well-structured with business units dedicated to organisation design and jobs are constantly evaluated and updated, which means it is possible to expand your role and be promoted. Generally, leadership creates a positive culture around life-work balance and wellbeing and the benefits are fantastic.
cons: Simultaneously, being such a large company means that processes approvals and implementations can be slow. Change takes an enormous amount of effort and time and such a large workforce means that employees are not at the same levels of maturity. For this reason, business units do not always work in synchronicity and this means that standards, approaches and adoption are not uniform.

headline: StandardBank experience
pros: Always paid on time. Never complained about the salary for the 9 years that was employed there. There's growth prospects. Salary is also very good.
cons: Shifts not aligned to customers needs. Not paid over time for 3 years. When you raise this you are told about behavior. They not encouraging dialog, they rule with fear and threats. If you want to go ahead, to raise any issues, just keep quite and raise those issues with your family. Not at work. They the value share as a proxy to instill fear and control.

headline: Opportunity due to race
pros: Unfortunately all the negativity around race based decisions in this company nullifies anything that could be positive.
cons: I almost did not get a job here as I am white and was told jobs are reserved for blacks. Working for this company was told that I would not get a promotion or even be considered for promotion due to me being white. The discrimination against white people extends much further and drives all hires to exclude whites as much as possible. Shares are only allocated to blacks irrespective how rich or poor they are so being “previously disadvantaged” does not matter and whites do not get any shares based on their race.

headline: Working for Standard Bank
pros: Staff benefits offered are great
cons:
- Bonuses are subject to who you know and who favors you
- Direct reporting lines incompetent, always dumping work on subordinates
- Management covers up for one another
- Hides behind client centricity when in actual fact they care about sales more than anything
- lower level employees not taken seriously
- Management is at Liberty to take leave anytime while employees are often denied leave when they actually need it
- It is difficult to find new opportunities internally as direct reporting lines give poor recommendations so that you do not get other positions
- Very toxic environment, lower level employees always complaining about management and how they want to leave the bank
